Package classes

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Rule
  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Rule that can be used to detect a code smell
    Author:
    Susana Polido, Pedro Pinheiro, Tiago Mendes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule​(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String expression)
        Rule constructor

        Creates a Rule from 2 Strings.

        Parameters:
        nome - The name of the code smell that can be detected with this rule example: "is_God_Class"
        expression - String that represents the actual rule example: "SE ( LOC_class > 5 OU LOC_class > 100 )"
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the arguments are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are empty

    • Method Detail

      • smellDetected

        public boolean smellDetected​(MethodData methodData)
        Sees if the code smell is present in a method.

        Using the data extracted from the code of a method, it sees if the method tests positive for the code smell represented by the rule.

        Copies and changes the expression of the rule so it resembles a boolean expression. Then changes the names of the metrics the rule checks with the corresponding data from the methodData. The final boolean result is calculated by a JavaScript engine.

        Parameters:
        methodData - the metrics of the method that is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the code smell was detected in the method, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null
        IllegalStatementException - if the final expression can't be turned into a boolean by the JavaScript engine
        See Also:
        MethodData

      • allRules

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Rule> allRules​(java.lang.String path)
                                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Extracts all the rules in a file

        Using a scanner it reads a file containing the lines necessary to create rules. Each rule is 2 lines, the 1st is the code smell it detects, the 2nd the expression that represents the rule.

        Parameters:
        file - File with several rules
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all rules in a file, if there's an error reading the file or no rules then it returns null
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if line not found.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the code smell the rule detects
        Returns:
        the rule's name

      • getExpression

        public java.lang.String getExpression()
        Gets the expression that represents the rule
